animation_delay="0" animation_offset=""]
A Waldorf-inspired educational alternative for South Florida families.
[/fusion_title][fusion_text]
Sunrise School of Miami is a true educational alternative that has been in existence in South Florida since 2005. Based on the belief that education should nurture children to become individuals whole in body, intellect, and spirit, our time-tested curriculum is rich in academics, integrated arts, and engaging specialty subjects, and it speaks to what is inherent in children; wonder, curiosity and joy.
Sunrise’s program is inspired by Waldorf education, where an age developmental approach focuses on developing intellectual abilities, artistic sensibilities, and the socio emotional growth of each child.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: delpuma
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="center" size="2" font_size="" animated_font_size="" fusion_font_family_title_font="" fusion_font_subset_title_font="" fusion_font_variant_title_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="#8c6c5a" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="single solid" sep_color="#ddbb33" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
ABOUT
[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
Sunrise School of Miami was launched in 2005 by six families who shared a desire to provide their children with a program that was an alternative to the high pressured testing environment common to most South Florida schools. They were inspired by Waldorf education, a worldwide independent school movement that was founded in 1919 by Austrian scientist, educator, and philosopher Dr. Rudolf Steiner, and they designed the curriculum following his principles and insights. They leased a space at a local church, and the journey began with nine students, two teachers, and regular help from visiting master teachers and mentors. The first eighth grade class was graduated in 2008, and we have since moved to a beautiful five and a half acre campus located in Palmetto Bay, Florida.
We now provide an early childhood through eighth grade education to nearly ninety students who come from the varied backgrounds that reflect the national, cultural, religious, and language diversity that is Miami’s trademark. However, our board, faculty, and parents all share in the common belief that education can draw out what is best in each child, and that it can be done in an artistic, creative, and loving manner.
As stated in our mission statement; “The essence of our mission is to engender wonder, reverence and respect, and to send forth into the world young people who possess a solid moral foundation and a capacity for empathy and transformative purpose.”
Waldorf education is one of the largest independent private school movements in the world, with more than 1,100 schools in 75 countries. The board and faculty seek to continue Sunrise School of Miami’s path to becoming fully engaged in the larger Waldorf School community, both in the United States and abroad.
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.dc:creator: delpuma

animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="single solid" sep_color="#ddbb33" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small=""] COMMUNITY [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] The healthy social life is found when, in the mirror of each human soul, the whole community finds its reflection, and when, in the community, the virtue of each one is living. Sunrise School of Miami enjoys a diverse community of students, families, teachers, staff and board members who come together in celebration of our school through festivals, events, and activities outside of the regular school day. Some of our highlights:
  • Our Red Bird’s Perch school store sells a variety of handmade dolls, toys, and games created by a dedicated group of parents.
  • Our school market sells delicious organic seasonal vegetables grown and nurtured by our students in our garden as part of the math and science curriculum.
  • The celebration of seasonal festivals is an integral feature of our school, and we bring together parents, grandparents, siblings, and friends for the many gatherings that we host during the school year.
  • Our parent-child program brings together mothers, fathers, and their two to four year-olds for play and an introduction to the concepts by which we operate.
  • Our summer programs concentrate on creative fun, and they provide a time to unwind and remain connected to the school and each other.
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

margin_bottom_small=""]
FESTIVALS AND CELEBRATIONS
[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]
The foundation of our school is the recognition of the wholeness and connection of humanity with all life. Rhythm and routine are paramount, and at Sunrise School of Miami they are most apparent in the celebration of seasonal festivals. These are opportunities for outward observation of nature’s seasonal changes, and they also bring us together as a community.
*Rose Ceremony: The first day of school at Sunrise is filled with tradition and celebration, and the Rose Ceremony signifies it best. First graders are presented with a rose by the 8th grade class, many of whom had been presented with them as first-graders. This ceremony represents the beginning of a young child’s journey into lifelong learning.
*Michaelmas: Michaelmas is the first festival of the year, and it stands as one of the cornerstones of the yearly festival cycle, taking place as close to September 29th as possible. The struggle of St. George and the dragon is a powerful Michaelmas image. His sword pierces the darkness that is winter, symbolizing the inner courage needed to shine light on both the outer darkness and the darkness within.
Martinmas or Lantern Festival: St. Martin was known for his ability to bring light and warmth to those in darkness, and the Martinmas Celebration is inspired by old customs that honor him. Children and parents gather as the sun sets, handmade lanterns are lit, and together they embark on a walk into the darkness. 0o
Advent Spiral: The advent spiral is perhaps one of the most deeply moving community festivals of the year. The spiral, an early childhood and lower grades festival, is one of light, movement, and symbolic change. One by one, while carrying an unlit candle, the children walk to the center of a spiral that has been laid out with greens, shells, plants, and carved animals. In the center stands a tall lit candle, and with help from an adult, the child lights their candle and places it on a spot of their choosing along the pathway, little by little bringing the entire spiral into the light. All who attend leave with a sense of reverence and peace.
St. Nicholas Day: This is a European tradition in which Bishop Nicholas and his mute companion, Rupert, visit the children. On the eve of December 5th, in many traditions, children place their shoes outside the door hoping St. Nicholas will leave a treat. Golden nuts, oranges and dates are left at the door as St. Nicholas and Rupert make a visit to the Early Childhood and grade school. The children eagerly await the tap at the door from his wooden walking staff!
Santa Lucia: A second grade student, dressed in white as Santa Lucia and wearing a crown aglow with four candles, leads a procession of classmates. They visit Early Childhood and each of the grades classes singing ‘Santa Lucia’ and carry their light throughout the school. The second graders are busy for days before, baking cookies that they will share with their schoolmates, as the procession travels through the school.
May Day: Our May Day celebration gives the students the opportunity to share this festival with family and friends. The grade school children enjoy the tradition of dancing to music around the May Pole which is decorated with flowers and colored ribbons. All of the students sing traditional spring songs. In addition to the festive dancing and singing, community is further formed by sharing light refreshments.
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][/fusion_builder_container]

EDUCATION
[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]
We are continuously seeking opportunities to enlighten and educate both the parent community and the community at large through enrichment programs. We have sponsored several lectures and movies such as the well- known “Race to Nowhere” which were both well attended and well received. We provide periodic weekend workshops, offering a chance for parents and faculty to enjoy each other in a relaxed and fun manner. In addition, we have hosted “Lifeways”, a program designed by educators for parents, teachers, and interested parties who interact with young children, and we will be offering future programing with this group as well.

ALUMNI
[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
Sunrise School is a true community, and many of our alumni remain in close contact. They often serve as elder statesmen to our children, and even become involved in our many festival celebrations. We are proud of their accomplishments, and the lifelong bond that has been created between their teachers, and fellow students.

animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="single solid" sep_color="#ddbb33" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small=""] CURRICULUM [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] In the early school years, children learn best when academics are conveyed through storytelling, painting, and other activities that speak to their hearts. As students mature, new levels of experience take place in each subject. Where the nature studies of kindergarten lead to interest in observing the plant kingdom in 5th grade, by the 8th grade students are ready and excited to delve into deeper scientific study. This holds true for all academic subjects. What Sets Us Apart:
  • The curriculum follows a block schedule, where one main academic area is taught for a period of several weeks.
  • The morning begins with a two hour main lesson period, allowing students to delve deeply into academic subjects.
  • Taught by specialty teachers, afternoons are devoted to activities such as practical arts, music, Eurythmy, a form of movement to speech and sound, and foreign languages. Other specialty subjects include orchestra beginning in 4th grade, gardening, woodworking, handwork, modeling, and drama.
  • The class teacher ideally takes the children from grades 1 through 8, teaching most main lesson subjects.
  • Textbooks are not used. Instead, the teacher creates the lesson, and the children make their own books for each subject, recording and illustrating the substance of their lessons. These books serve as an artistic and lifelong record of accomplishment and development.
  • Two foreign languages are taught.
  • Music permeates all that takes place at Sunrise School of Miami. Singing is a daily occurrence, and musical instruments abound, progressing from simple flutes in the first grade to the recorder in 3rd, to the violin or cello in the 5th.
  • All four math operations are introduced through activities such as clapping games and stories in the first grade, and progress into more concrete concepts as the children age.
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][/fusion_builder_container]

margin_bottom_small=""] WHAT WE STRIVE TO ACHIEVE [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]
  • Innovative Thinking: Through the long-term curriculum where the relationship between different studies is tightly interwoven, we are given the opportunity to freely discover the many solutions to any given problem. Then as adults we will be capable of creative problem solving.
  • Self-Motivation: If given appropriate responsibilities and the opportunity to work independently, then as adults we will enjoy high self-esteem and an ability to be fully capable of setting and reaching goals.
  • Social Responsibility: If hallmarks of emotional maturity are cultivated in the social environment, and difficulties in relationships are transformed into learning experiences, then as adults we will succeed in all of our partnerships, and we will be ready to take an active role in the direction that humanity takes.
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: Curriculum by the Grades
item.dc:creator: delpuma
item.content:encoded: [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" margin_bottom_small=""] CURRICULUM BY THE GRADES [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] First Grade: Introduction to letters and writing through story and picture; phonics and sight vocabulary; fairy tales and nature stories; simple addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Second Grade: Expanded writing and reading; cursive writing; beginning grammar; fables and saints’ legends; arithmetic with larger numbers; numerical patterns and forms; times tables. Third Grade: Composition, reading, speech; Old Testament stories; cursive writing; farming and gardening; shelter and building; arithmetic with complicated numbers and practical examples; measurement (time, money, weights), grammar (basic parts of speech, sentence building and structure, punctuation and capitalization), reading and writing music. Fourth Grade: Composition, letter writing, alliterative poetry; grammar (tenses, more parts of speech); Norse mythology and other northern European sagas; Native American legends; local geography and history; fractions; animals in relation to the human being. Fifth Grade: Composition and continuing grammar studies; mythology of ancient civilizations (India, Persia, Babylonia, Egypt and Greece); North American geography; botany; review of fractions, the metric system, decimals. Sixth Grade: Composition; public speaking; Roman and early Medieval history; European geography; geology; physics (optics, heat and acoustics); astronomy; constructive geometry; mathematical word problems; business math and algebra (interest, percentage, discount). Seventh Grade: Creative writing; Renaissance culture, the Reformation, the age of exploration; South American geography; physics (heat and mechanics); inorganic chemistry; nutrition and physiology; algebra. Eighth Grade: Practical writing; Shakespeare; history from the Age of Revolution to the present; world geography (Africa, Asia and Australia); physics (electricity and magnetism); organic chemistry, algebra; solid geometry; meteorology and climatology. In addition to the comprehensive academic curriculum, all children receive training in vocal and instrumental music, Spanish and Mandarin for their foreign language study, painting and drawing, modeling, woodworking (upper grades), handcrafts (e.g. knitting, crocheting, embroidering, sewing), orchestra, dramatic arts, games and movement education. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Our admissions team will introduce you to the richness of our program and to our dynamic community, and they will help you to navigate the admissions process. Admissions is open to qualified students in Kindergarten through 8th grade, regardless of racial, ethnic, religious, and socio-economic backgrounds. We are located at 14920 Southwest 67th Avenue in Palmetto Bay, Florida 305-274-6562 Please call us to schedule a visit. We look forward to meeting you and your family. item.title: How to Apply
item.dc:creator: delpuma
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right="" type="legacy"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="true" min_height="" hover_type="none" link="" border_sizes_top="" border_sizes_bottom="" border_sizes_left="" border_sizes_right="" first="true"][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="center" size="2" font_size="" animated_font_size="" fusion_font_family_title_font="" fusion_font_subset_title_font="" fusion_font_variant_title_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="#8c6c5a" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="single solid" sep_color="#ddbb33" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small=""] HOW TO APPLY [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""][/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]We are delighted that you are considering Sunrise School of Miami for your child and recognize that selecting the right school will be one of the most important decisions you can make. Our enrollment team looks forward to helping you with this process.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="4" font_size="" animated_font_size="" fusion_font_family_title_font="" fusion_font_subset_title_font="" fusion_font_variant_title_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="5%" margin_bottom="" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="#8c6c5a" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="underline dotted" sep_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small=""] PreK, Kindergarten, Grade School and Middle School Admissions Process [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] Step 1:  Schedule a Tour (for parents only)  Step 2:  Application  Following a tour, parents submit to SSoM all of the following, which will be provided by the Admissions office:
  • Application for Admission 
  • Emergency Contact Form 
  • Teacher Recommendation Form completed by current school 
  • Copy of Birth Certificate
  • School Reports, Evaluations, Report Cards and Testing results if applicable
  • Most current Health and Immunization records
  • Current picture of your child
  • $150 non-refundable application fee
Step 3:  Schedule Student Visit Upon receipt and review of all completed forms and fees, the Admissions Office will contact the family to schedule a 3-day visitation for Grade School and Middle School applicants and a half-day visitation for PreK and Kindergarten applicants.   Step 4:  Parent Interview Following the student visit, we will schedule a parent interview with the teacher and Admissions personnel. Step 5:  Notification Following the parent interview, the family will be notified of our admissions decision.  The admissions process takes approximately three weeks after receipt of all application documents. *Sunrise School of Miami is a provider for select Step Up For Students scholarships. We currently accept the Florida Tax Credit Scholarship (FTC) and the Family Empowerment Scholarship for Educational Options (FES-EO). [/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="3%" bottom_margin="3%" border_size="" icon="" icon_size="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_testimonials design="classic" navigation="no" speed="" backgroundcolor="rgba(161,166,128,0.65)" textcolor="" random="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""][fusion_testimonial name="SSoM Parent" avatar="none" image="" image_id="" image_border_radius="" company="" link="" target="_self"] “This has been the best choice for my kids and for us as a family. The community is absolutely lovely. The classes are small and my kids are truly thriving. They have ample joy in their lives. They play hard OUTSIDE!! They have music, incredible art, they are in beautiful classrooms. The teacher’s bring a beautifully rich and diverse curriculum. The benefits are incredible. We see that 8th graders go onto top schools for high school easily. Beyond the academic and soulful enrichment for the kids, it's a wonderful community.” [/fusion_testimonial][/fusion_testimonials][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="3%" bottom_margin="3%" border_size="" icon="" icon_size="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

SUPPORT US
[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
Sunrise School’s founders fully understood that the undertaking that they were embarking on would be a selfless, daunting, and expensive task, yet an extremely rewarding quest.
The original vision was to keep tuitions as low as possible, and teachers’ salaries as high as possible. That mission continues.
We call on our community of parents, our board, and outside donors and friends to help us to bring about the extras that make our program the rich and well-rounded education that it is. This can be accomplished only through generous contributions. Our Annual Fund campaign, legacy giving outreach, annual gifting, and other programs allow us to provide supplemental training for our teachers, field trips for our students, specialty teachers, traveling mentors, educational programs for our parent body, and much more. We are exceedingly grateful to have the generous support that we enjoy, and we are emboldened by the confirmation of our work that it signifies.
Sunrise School of Miami is a 501(c)(3) organization, and all donations are tax-deductible. To make a donation, please contact our office at 305-274-6562.
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][/fusion_builder_container]

alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]

Join Sunrise School of Miami’s Growing Community!

Step into the light and warmth of Sunrise School of Miami. Our vibrant community is expanding, and we invite you to become a part of our experienced and supportive team.

Positions Available:

  • Early Childhood
  • Kindergarten
  • Grades 1–8
  • Substitutes

About Sunrise School of Miami

Located in metropolitan Miami, FL—a dynamic, multicultural city with strong ties to the Caribbean and Latin America—Sunrise School of Miami is now in its 20th year, serving students from Kindergarten through 8th Grade. Class sizes range from 10–14 students. Over the past few years, our school has flourished with the addition of a Parent-Child Program, full enrollment in our two Kindergartens, and plans for launching a third. Our talented and experienced teachers foster an environment of warmth, collaboration, and joyful collegiality. Subject teachers provide Spanish, Mandarin, woodworking, movement, chorus, handwork, orchestra, and gardening instruction. Our gardening program features a seasonal produce market offering bananas, dragon fruit, and more—creating a beloved Friday afternoon gathering spot. Parents actively support our school through participation in festivals, contributions to our school store, and even a twice-monthly ukulele and singing group with teachers and staff.

We Seek Individuals Who:

  • Build healthy relationships with parents, students, and colleagues
  • Demonstrate excellent teaching, classroom management, and communication skills
  • Possess a deep understanding of students’ development, learning styles, and needs
  • Are self-directed, creative, artistic, and collaborative
  • Are knowledgeable of and committed to Waldorf education and Anthroposophy
  • Have experience working with children with learning challenges or a specialization in reading (preferred but not required)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • A Bachelor’s degree or higher
  • Prior teaching experience, ideally in a Waldorf school
  • Completion of or current enrollment in Waldorf teacher training (student teachers are encouraged to apply)

Salary and Benefits:

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including:
  • Health insurance subsidies
  • Professional development support
  • Full tuition remission for children of full-time teachers

To Apply:

Please email the following documents to the Hiring Committee, at employment@sunriseschoolofmiami.org:
  • Letter of interest, including a brief biography
  • Resume
  • Three professional references (include phone numbers and email addresses)
Candidates must have authorization to work in the United States. animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset=""]

Parent Child Program



[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]

Our Parent-Child Program offers parents a chance to learn about Waldorf-inspired Early Childhood principles and how they can be applied at home.

We welcome children between the ages of 2-4 and their parents or caregivers. The program is held outdoors and includes eight weekly sessions, held on Mondays or Wednesdays.

Since young children learn through imitation, parents are encouraged to fully participate in all activities and assist with daily tasks, guided by the teacher.

Together, teachers and parents create a model of community for the young child, making this a wonderful opportunity for families to come together and immerse themselves in our nurturing environment.

Our Winter 2025 Parent Child Program is Full! Thank you for your interest in our Parent Child Program. Please check back in February when we open registration for the Spring 2025 Session.

Spring 2025

Mondays: March 17th - May 19th

Wednesdays: March 19th - May 14th (No classes on April 21, April 23, or May 5)

Cost: $325 for the 8-week session

Please fill out the form below to express your interest. Make sure you sign up for our Community Newsletter to be among the first to receive registration updates for when registration is open.

We look forward to welcoming you and your child to this enriching experience! 



[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] Please see Registration Below: [fluentform id="10"] [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: Thank you for your payment!

item.content:encoded: Your payment has been submitted - Thank you!

text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] Application fees:   A $150 non-refundable application fee is required upon submission of application. This is a one- time fee for all newly applying students. Application fees are not required for returning students. Registration fees:  A non-refundable annual registration fee is required of all students. Registration fee for new students is $600 if paid by due date, $1,000 if paid after due date. Registration fees for returning students is $350 by due date, $1,000 if paid after due date. After School Care:  Available until 5:00 pm. 
  • PreK/Kindergarten Program - children should be picked up at 12:30 pm and no later than 12:40 pm. Children who have not been picked up by 12:40 pm will be signed into our Kinder Extended program. There will be a $25 charge billed if children are picked up after this time.
  • PreK/Kindergarten Extended Program - children should be picked up at 3:00 pm and no later than 3:15 pm. Children who have not been picked up by 3:15 pm will be signed into our Aftercare program and parents will be billed at drop-in rates of $10.00/hour. This is billed in 15-minute increments or fraction thereof.
  • Grade School and Middle School Programs -parents should pick their children up at 3:30 pm and no later than 3:45 pm. Children who have not been picked up by 3:45 pm will be signed into our Aftercare program and parents will be billed at drop-in rates of $10.00/hour. This is billed in 15-minute increments or fraction thereof.
  • Prepaid monthly after-care rate is $235 for Kindergarten Extended and $170 for Grade School and must be paid by the 5th day of the month otherwise daily drop-in rates will apply. Pickup after 5:00 pm is billed at a rate of $3.00 per minute.
Annual Fund Campaign:  Parents, faculty, staff and friends of the school are expected to contribute to our Annual Fund Campaign. The money raised helps offset the cost of running the school. The amount given is at each family’s discretion, however, our goal is that 100% of our school community participate. Instrument lessons:  Individual lessons outside of school are required for all students in the violin and Orchestra programs.   Payment Options: Tuition will be paid in 12 monthly installments through the automated payment system (FACTS). A 10% non-refundable deposit is due June 1, 2025. The balance is due in 11 equal payments July 1, 2025 – May 1, 2026. All tuition must be paid in full by May 1, 2026 regardless of enrollment date. Tuition and Fees: Tuition includes the cost of most materials.  There may also be additional charges for supplies and special materials that are not provided by the school.  Tuition does not cover the cost of class trips, field trips or other incidental minor costs.  A charge of $75.00 will be applied to any payment received after the due date, to any returned check or to any failed transaction processed on or after June 1, 2025 under SSoM’s new automated payment processing system. Sibling discounts are available. Credit card transactions are subject to a 4% processing fee. Step Up for Students: Sunrise School of Miami is a provider for select Step Up For Students scholarships. We currently accept the Florida Tax Credit Scholarship (FTC) and the Family Empowerment Scholarship for Educational Options (FES-EO). Sunrise School of Miami does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, familial status, national and ethnic origin in administration of its educational policies, admissions policies, tuition assistance programs, athletic and other school-administered programs.    [/fusion_text][fusion_button link="http://sunriseschoolofmiami.org/schedule-a-tour/" text_transform="" title="" target="_self" link_attributes="" alignment="" modal="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" color="custom" button_gradient_top_color="#a1a680" button_gradient_bottom_color="#a1a680" button_gradient_top_color_hover="#ff9800" button_gradient_bottom_color_hover="#ff9800" accent_color="" accent_hover_color="" type="" bevel_color="" border_color="" border_hover_color="" size="" stretch="default" icon="" icon_position="left" icon_divider="no" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Schedule a Tour[/fusion_button][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="3%" bottom_margin="3%" border_size="" icon="" icon_size="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.dc:creator: delpuma

Parent Child Program



[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] Our Parent-Child Program offers parents a chance to learn about Waldorf-inspired Early Childhood principles and how they can be applied at home. We welcome children between the ages of 2-4 and their parents or caregivers. The program is held outdoors and includes eight weekly sessions, on Mondays or Wednesdays. Since young children learn through imitation, parents are encouraged to fully participate in all activities and assist with daily tasks, guided by the teacher. Together, teachers and parents create a model of community for the young child, making this a wonderful opportunity for families to come together and immerse themselves in our nurturing environment.

Winter 2026:

Mondays: January 5th - March 9th (no class January 19 & February 16)

Wednesdays: January 7th - March 4th (no class February 18)

Cost: $325 for the 8-week session

Register now as space is limited!

Workshop



[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]

Arts and Movement: The Foundations for Learning

How Movement, Drawing, and Painting strengthen the foundations for both academics and athletics, a workshop with Jeff Tunkey.

Sunrise School of Miami invites you for a morning workshop on Saturday, January 11th, with longtime Waldorf teacher and author Jeff Tunkey. The importance of developmental movement is clearly validated by modern science as a path to physiological and emotional classroom readiness, and might be just as important as academic presentation, especially in the early grades. Activities that build such basics as postural control, spatial orientation, physical coordination, and body geography are not merely “classroom extras.” Because true learning requires inner composure and flexibility, all children need a rich diet of developmental movement, drawing, and painting exercises. Come learn more about Sunrise School of Miami's approach to building the foundations of communication, teamwork, adaptability, responsibility, self-control, persistence, punctuality and joyful athleticism.

About Jeff Tunkey

For 30 years while at Aurora Waldorf School (near Buffalo, New York), Jeff taught both Physical Education and the academic-support program known as the Extra Lesson. He also became a “teacher of teachers” from North America and beyond, via a series of week-long summer movement-foundations intensives, courses for the Association for a Healing Education, and dozens of Waldorf school visits.

More about the workshop

Jeff Tunkey will participate in an open panel with Sunrise School of Miami Movement teacher, Mr. Orlando Colon, and Ms. Luiza Kwiatkowska, our Kindergarten teacher and a graduate of the Association for a Healing Education, qualifying her to be an Educational Support or “Extra Lesson” teacher.

Together, they will discuss how a multi-dimensional program of movement and artistic activities strengthens the foundations for both academics and athletics at Sunrise School of Miami. After the discussion, activities will be brought to participants. Come ready to move!

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""][/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

animation_offset=""] ANNUAL FUND CAMPAIGN 2025-2026 [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]

At Sunrise School of Miami (SSOM), each day begins with a gesture of wonder, a song, a story, a brush dipped in color. These small daily moments are the heartbeat of our school, and they are sustained by the love, care, and generosity of our community.

We are delighted to share the launch of our 2025–2026 Annual Fund Campaign: Sustaining Today’s Magic.

The Annual Fund is what allows our teachers to bring beauty and reverence into the classroom, to weave music and movement into each child’s day, and to create an environment where curiosity and imagination can flourish.

Your gift is immediately present in the life of the school, in the warmth of the classrooms, the joy of the festivals, and the twinkle of discovery in the eyes of our children.

We invite you to join us with a contribution. With your partnership, we will reach our $150,000 goal and carry this work forward with strength and grace.

Summer Camp



[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]

Summer Camp at SSoM: A Season of Wonder and Joy

Where childhood blossoms through nature, creativity, and play.

Each June, Sunrise School of Miami offers a joyful two-week Summer Camp. This special program invites children to explore, create, and connect in a warm, nurturing environment. Grounded in creativity and nature, our camp provides hands-on experiences that inspire a deep connection to the world around them. Campers enjoy nature walks, crafting with natural materials, gardening and planting, outdoor games, music, movement, and imaginative play. Whether your child loves making art, discovering the outdoors, or simply moving and playing with friends, there’s something meaningful waiting for them at SSoM. The 2026 Summer Camp details and rates will be announced this winter. We look forward to seeing you for a season full of wonder and unforgettable memories!

fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""] The Sunrise School of Miami Early Childhood Program is designed to nurture the whole child—mind, body, and spirit—through a holistic approach to early education. Inspired by the principles of Waldorf education, our program creates a warm, nurturing environment that fosters imagination, creativity, and a lifelong love of learning. The early years of a child’s life are a time of wonder, discovery, and growth. Our purpose is to honor and protect the magic of childhood while laying a strong foundation for social, emotional, and intellectual development. We strive to support each child's unique developmental needs, creating an environment that feels like a second home—a place of comfort, joy, and exploration.

The Sunrise School of Miami Early Childhood Program aims to:

1. Nurture the Whole Child We focus on fostering each child’s physical, emotional, and cognitive development. Through purposeful play, artistic activities, and daily rhythms, children develop essential life skills and a sense of inner balance.

2. Encourage Imagination and Creativity Imaginative play is the cornerstone of our early childhood program. It allows children to explore their world, develop problem-solving skills, and build their capacity for creative thinking.

3. Foster Social Skills and CommunityIn a Waldorf classroom, children learn the importance of collaboration, empathy, and respect. Through group activities like singing, storytelling, and shared tasks, we cultivate a sense of belonging and community.

4. Establish Healthy Rhythms A consistent daily rhythm provides security and helps children feel grounded. Activities such as circle time, outdoor play, and mealtimes are carefully structured to align with the natural rhythms of a child’s day.

5. Connect with Nature Time spent outdoors is integral to our program. Nature-based learning fosters a deep connection to the world around us, encourages curiosity, provides nourishment for the senses, resilience, and a sense of stewardship for the earth.

What Makes Our Program Unique?

  • Play-Based Learning: We emphasize hands-on, unstructured play as a vital tool for learning and development.
  • Natural Materials: Our classrooms are filled with simple, natural materials that spark imagination and creativity.
  • Artistic Expression: Painting, drawing, handcrafts, and music are woven into our daily activities to enrich the child’s experience.
  • Storytelling and Movement: Engaging stories and movement activities help develop language skills, coordination, and a love for learning.

A typical day includes:

  • Morning circle with songs and movement
  • Free, imaginative play with open-ended materials and toys
  • Outdoor exploration and nature walks
  • Storytelling and puppet shows
  • Creative artistic activities such as painting, baking, or crafting

Enroll Now

Our program is a gentle yet purposeful start to your child’s educational journey. We invite you to visit our school, meet our dedicated teachers, and experience the magic of our Early Childhood classroom. Spaces are limited. Contact us today to learn more about how Sunrise School of Miami can support your child’s growth and development during these formative years.

Click here to learn more about How to Apply and here to learn more about our Parent Child Program.

May Faire 2025



[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" margin_top="" margin_right="" margin_bottom="" margin_left="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]

Mark your calendars and celebrate the beauty of spring at Sunrise School of Miami’s beloved May Faire! Join us on Saturday, May 3rd, from 11:30 am to 4:45 pm for a day filled with joy, community, and enchantment. This festive event is our biggest open-to-the-public celebration of the year, offering families a chance to experience the magic of our school. Enjoy a variety of activities, including:
  • Traditional Maypole Dance
  • Fun games for all ages
  • Delicious food and drinks
  • Face painting
  • A charming puppet show
  • Silent auction with wonderful prizes
  • Artisanal vendors showcasing unique handcrafted goods
Admission is free, and activity tickets will be available for purchase at the entrance. Bring your friends and family for a memorable day of fun and community spirit! Click here to RSVP.

Become a Vendor or Sponsor

We are actively seeking artisanal vendors and sponsorships for this special event! This is a great opportunity to showcase your craft or support a vibrant community gathering. For more information, please contact us at admin@sunriseschoolofmiami.org

item.title: The Rose Ceremony
item.dc:creator: marisa
item.content:encoded: On the first day of the 2025–26 school year, the Sunrise School of Miami community gathered in the Rock Garden for one of our most cherished traditions—the Rose Ceremony. This beautiful annual event marks a profound moment of transition: the crossing from early childhood into the grade school years. It is a time when our entire community—faculty, students, and families, both new and returning—comes together to celebrate growth, continuity, and connection. As music filled the garden, performed by Melissa Adames, Liliana Colón, and Orlando Colón, the rising first grade children passed beneath rainbow silks and crossed the wooden bridge. This gesture symbolizes moving from one stage of life to the next, carrying with them the innocence of childhood while stepping toward new challenges and discoveries. On the other side, they were welcomed with a rose by an eighth-grade student—a living symbol of beauty, strength, and unfolding potential. Finally, each child was greeted by their new teacher, Kaitlyn Lugo, who will guide them in this next chapter of their learning journey. The Rose Ceremony is not only a rite of passage for our first graders but also a way of welcoming all new families into our community and reuniting with those returning. It reminds us that education is a shared path, built on relationships that connect past, present, and future, younger and older, child and parent, teacher and student. After the ceremony, families, faculty, and friends gathered for a joyful breakfast organized by our second-grade parents—an opportunity to reconnect, share stories, and step into the year ahead together. The Rose Ceremony is more than a tradition; it is a reflection of our belief that every child’s growth is supported and celebrated within the fabric of community life.

animation_offset=""] ANNUAL FUND CAMPAIGN 2025-2026 [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hue="" saturation="" lightness="" alpha="" user_select="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" letter_spacing="" text_transform="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_color="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_delay="0" animation_offset="" logics=""]

At Sunrise School of Miami (SSOM), each day begins with a gesture of wonder, a song, a story, a brush dipped in color. These small daily moments are the heartbeat of our school, and they are sustained by the love, care, and generosity of our community.

We are delighted to share the launch of our 2025–2026 Annual Fund Campaign: Sustaining Today’s Magic.

The Annual Fund is what allows our teachers to bring beauty and reverence into the classroom, to weave music and movement into each child’s day, and to create an environment where curiosity and imagination can flourish.

Your gift is immediately present in the life of the school, in the warmth of the classrooms, the joy of the festivals, and the twinkle of discovery in the eyes of our children.

We invite every family to join us with a contribution of $1,200 per child or more. With deep care, SSOM continues to keep tuition among the lowest of Miami’s private schools, while working diligently so that families may continue to benefit from the Step Up scholarships.

We are blessed to have received the support of an anonymous donor who will contribute $30,000 if 100% participationis attained from our Board, Faculty, Staff, and Parents by October 17, 2025. With your partnership, we will reach our $150,000 goal and carry this work forward with strength and grace.

*This page is dedicated to school families only. We will be happy to accept donations from other families, just click here to be redirected!
